engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Postulating the existence of a barrier that hides complex underlying systems and processes, thereby preventing direct interaction and maintaining predictability and orderliness.

Utilizing the laws of physics that govern the behavior of matter and energy, specifically general relativity and quantum mechanics, to form the basis of the hypothesis and achieve the desired outcome.
Creating a boundary or buffer zone that separates the system from the external environment, effectively hiding it from view and preventing direct interaction.
